Class Polynomial

java.lang.Object
  Polynomial

public class Polynomial
extends java.lang.Object

The Polynomial class is an abstract representation of a polynomial with N terms, where N equals coefficients.length. For example: Ax^2+BX+C is a polynomial where coefficients[0]=A, coefficients[1]=B, coefficients[2]=C. A main purpose of this class is to take multiple points into a constructer, and create a Polynomial that intersects all the points, with flowing curves. int[] points holds the points that were initially used to create the Polynomial, in the format of x1,y1,x2,y2,x3,y3...

Polynomial

public Polynomial(int[] points,
                  int start,
                  int stop)
Creates a Polynomial from an array of points, a start, and a stop value.

Parameters:
points - The points used to generate the function.
start - Starting value of the funciton.
stop - The right bound of the function.

Polynomial

public Polynomial(Polynomial p)

Polynomial

public Polynomial(java.lang.String[] info)
This is a constructer designed to construct a Polynomial from file. A .txt File is read, and separated into multiple String[] objects, one for each Polynomial. Then each discreet String[] is fed into this constructer. All the polynomials are then used to instantiate a Level object.

Method Detail

changeXShift

public void changeXShift(int xChange)
This method changes xShift by xChange pixels. For example if the graph was shifted over 150 pixels, and this method was called with xChange=25 the graph would shift over an additional 25 pixels, with a final xShift value of 175.

Parameters:
xChange - The value to shift the graph by.

changeYShift

public void changeYShift(int yChange)
This method changes yShift by yChange pixels. For example if the graph was shifted over 150 pixels, and this method was called with yChange=25 then the graph would shift down an additional 25 pixels, with a final yShift value of 175. Please note that y=0 is at the top of the screen, and that the bottom of the screen is a positive value getHeight(), which can be called from the DrawPanel class.

Parameters:
xChange - The value to shift the graph by.

doubleHeight

public double doubleHeight(int x)
Returns the height with double precision.

Parameters:
x - value inputted
Returns:
returns the y value as a function of x.

draw

public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
Obsolete method. Draws a Polynomial object.

Parameters:
g - This is the Graphics Object that is being used to draw. By accepting a Graphics Object as a parameter it allows the drawing to be done within each individual class, rather than have a superfluous amount of code in the driver.

equals

returns all X values where F(X)=value

Parameters:
value - a value searched for.
Returns:
returns the x coordinates where f(x)=value

getCoefficients

public double[] getCoefficients()
Returns:
Returns the coefficients that form the Polynomial. If the function is represented by Ax^3+BX^2+CX+D, it returns A,B,C,D in a double[].

globalDraw

public void globalDraw(java.awt.Graphics g,
                       int globalX,
                       int globalY)
Draws a Polynomial object with respect to a global shift variable.

Parameters:
g - This is the Graphics Object that is being used to draw. By accepting a Graphics Object as a parameter it allows the drawing to be done within each individual class, rather than have a superfluous amount of code in the driver.
globalX - An external variable that is used to shift the graph, used in relation to a moving point of reference.
globalY - Shifts the graph vertically by this value.

height

public int height(int x)
Returns the height of this Polynomial without respect to any xShift or globalX shifting variables.

Parameters:
x - this is the x in y=f(x)
Returns:
returns the y value as a function of the x value.

print

public void print()
Primarily for demo purposes, this method prints all the key data held in a Polynomial.

save

public java.lang.String[] save()
This method was designed to be used in conjustion with the Level.save() method. The returned String[] is appended to a .txt file that contains all the Polynomials in the Level object.

Returns:
This returns a list of String that contains all the data held in a Polynomial.

setBounds

public void setBounds(int start,
                      int stop)
This sets the bounds of the polynomial. A polynomial is continuous (-infinity,infinity), therefore bounds must be set to determine what part of the function is graphed.

Parameters:
start - The left bound.
stop - The right bound.

setCoefficients

public void setCoefficients(double[] coefficients)
If the function is represented by Ax^3+BX^2+CX+D, this method replace those A,B,C,D with new values.

Parameters:
coefficients - This will set the A,B,C,D... values to the values found in coefficients.

setColor

public void setColor(java.awt.Color color)
Sets the color of this polynomial.

Parameters:
color - The color this Polynomial will be set to.

setStart

public void setStart(int start)
This sets the left bound only.

Parameters:
start - The left bound.

setStop

public void setStop(int stop)
This sets the right bound only.

Parameters:
stop - The right bound.

setXShift

public void setXShift(int xShift)
This method sets how much the graph is shifted in the X axis.

Parameters:
xShift - The value to shift the graph by.

setYShift

public void setYShift(int yShift)
This method sets the YShift value, which is used to shift the whole graph up or down.

Parameters:
yShift - The value to shift the graph by.

solve

public static double[] solve(double[] points)
This method takes an array of points, in double format to ensure arithmetic precision, and converts it to the coefficients of a polynomial that intersects the given points. This is most important method in this class.

Parameters:
points - A series of points formatted as an array of doubles.
